title: #ComputerSystem.v1_2_0.ComputerSystem

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

ClearNetworkHistoryUsageRate.description: This action is used to clear the network history usage rate.
ClearNetworkHistoryUsageRate.longDescription: This action is used to clear the network history usage rate.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AddSwiIpv6Addr.description: This action is used to add the switch fru IPv6 addresses.
AddSwiIpv6Addr.longDescription: This action is used to add the switch fru IPv6 addresses.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

DelSwiIpv6Addr.description: This action is used to delete the switch fru IPv6 addresses.
DelSwiIpv6Addr.longDescription: This action is used to delete the switch fru IPv6 addresses.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AddSwiIpv6Route.description: This action is used to add the switch fru IPv6 routes.
AddSwiIpv6Route.longDescription: This action is used to add the switch fru IPv6 routes.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

DelSwiIpv6Route.description: This action is used to delete the switch fru IPv6 routes.
DelSwiIpv6Route.longDescription: This action is used to delete the switch fru IPv6 routes.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

FruControl.description: This action is used to FruControl the system.
FruControl.longDescription: This action shall execute a set of frucontrol instructions for an FRU. The PowerOn value shall power on an FRU. The GracefulShutdown value shall power off an FRU. The ForceRestart value shall reset an FRU by pressing the reset button on the chassis. The ForcePowerCycle value shall forcibly power off an FRU and then power it on about six seconds later. The Nmi value shall trigger a non-maskable interrupt (Nmi) when the OS is unavailable. Do not apply Diagnosis Reset when the server is operating properly.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Reset.description: This action is used to reset the system.
Reset.longDescription: This action shall perform a reset of the ComputerSystem.  For systems which implement APCI Power Button functionality, the PushPowerButton value shall perform or emulate an ACPI Power Button push.  The ForceOff value shall remove power from the system or perform an ACPI Power Button Override (commonly known as a 4-second hold of the Power Button).  The ForceRestart value shall perform a ForceOff action followed by a On action.

enumDescriptions.None: Boot from the normal boot device.
enumDescriptions.Pxe: Boot from the Pre-Boot EXecution (PXE) environment.
enumDescriptions.Floppy: Boot from the floppy disk drive.
enumDescriptions.Usb: Boot from a USB device as specified by the system BIOS.
enumDescriptions.BiosSetup: Boot to the BIOS Setup Utility.
enumDescriptions.UefiTarget: Boot to the UEFI Device specified in the UefiTargetBootSourceOverride property.
enumDescriptions.UefiHttp: Boot from a UEFI HTTP network location.
enumDescriptions.RemoteDrive: Boot from a remote drive (e.g. iSCSI).

enumDescriptions.Once: On its next boot cycle, the system will boot (one time) to the Boot Source Override Target. The value of BootSourceOverrideEnabled is then reset back to Disabled.
enumDescriptions.Continuous: The system will boot to the target specified in the BootSourceOverrideTarget until this property is set to Disabled.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

enumDescriptions.Unknown: The state of the Indicator LED cannot be determined. Deprecated: Return null if state is unknown.

enumDescriptions.Off: The system is powered off, although some components may continue to have AUX power such as management controller.
enumDescriptions.PoweringOn: A temporary state between Off and On. This temporary state can be very short.
enumDescriptions.PoweringOff: A temporary state between On and Off. The power off action can take time while the OS is in the shutdown process.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Count.description: The number of processors in the system.
Count.longDescription: This property shall contain the number of central processors in the system.

Model.description: The processor model for the primary or majority of processors in this system.
Model.longDescription: This property shall contain the processor model for the central processors in the system, per the description in Table 22 of the SMBIOS Specification DSP0134 2.8 or later.

ProcessorSummary.description: This object describes the central processors of the system in general detail.

enumDescriptions.Virtual: A virtual machine instance running on this system.
enumDescriptions.PhysicallyPartitioned: A hardware-based partition of a computer system.
enumDescriptions.VirtuallyPartitioned: A virtual or software-based partition of a computer system.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

BootSourceOverrideTarget.description: The current boot source to be used at next boot instead of the normal boot device, if BootSourceOverrideEnabled is true.
BootSourceOverrideTarget.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the source to boot the system from, overriding the normal boot order. The valid values for this property are specified through the Redfish.AllowableValues annotation. Pxe indicates to PXE boot from the primary NIC; Floppy, Cd, Usb, Hdd indicates to boot from their devices respectively. BiosSetup indicates to boot into the native BIOS screen setup. Utilities and Diags indicate to boot from the local utilities or diags partitions and UefiTarget indicates to boot from the UEFI device path found in UefiTargetBootSourceOverride.

BootSourceOverrideEnabled.description: Describes the state of the Boot Source Override feature.
BootSourceOverrideEnabled.longDescription: The value of this property shall be Once if this is a one time boot override and Continuous if this selection should remain active until cancelled. If the property value is set to Once, the value will be reset back to Disabled after the BootSourceOverrideTarget actions have been completed.

UefiTargetBootSourceOverride.description: This property is the UEFI Device Path of the device to boot from when BootSourceOverrideSupported is UefiTarget.
UefiTargetBootSourceOverride.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the UEFI device path of the override boot target. The valid values for this property are specified through the Redfish.AllowableValues annotation. BootSourceOverrideEnabled = Continuous is not supported for UEFI Boot Source Override as this setting is defined in UEFI as a one time boot only.

BootSourceOverrideMode.description: The BIOS Boot Mode (either Legacy or UEFI) to be used when BootSourceOverrideTarget boot source is booted from.
BootSourceOverrideMode.longDescription: The value of this property shall be Legacy for non-UEFI BIOS boot or UEFI for UEFI boot from boot source specified in BootSourceOverrideTarget property.

Boot.description: This object contains the boot information for the current resource.

enumDescriptions.Legacy: The system will boot in non-UEFI boot mode to the Boot Source Override Target.
enumDescriptions.UEFI: The system will boot in UEFI boot mode to the Boot Source Override Target.

enumDescriptions.System: The system supports DIMM mirroring at the System level.  Individual DIMMs are not paired for mirroring in this mode.
enumDescriptions.DIMM: The system supports DIMM mirroring at the DIMM level.  Individual DIMMs can be mirrored.
enumDescriptions.Hybrid: The system supports a hybrid mirroring at the system and DIMM levels.  Individual DIMMs can be mirrored.
enumDescriptions.None: The system does not support DIMM mirroring.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

TotalSystemMemoryGiB.description: The total installed, operating system-accessible memory (RAM), measured in GiB.
TotalSystemMemoryGiB.longDescription: This property shall contain the amount of system general purpose volatile (RAM) memory as measured in gibibytes.

MemoryMirroring.description: The ability and type of memory mirroring supported by this system.
MemoryMirroring.longDescription: This property shall contain the ability and type of memory mirring supported by this system.

MemorySummary.description: This object describes the memory of the system in general detail.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Count.description: The number of storages in the system.
Count.longDescription: This property shall contain the number of storages in the system.

StorageSummary.description: This object describes the storages of the system in general detail.

Count.description: The number of logical drives in the system.
Count.longDescription: This property shall contain the number of logical drives in the system.

LogicalDriveSummary.description: This object describes the logical drives of the system in general detail.

FirmwareVersion.description: The firmware version of this Trusted Module.
FirmwareVersion.longDescription: This property shall contain the firwmare version as defined by the manufacturer for the Trusted Module.

InterfaceType.description: This property indicates the interface type of the Trusted Module.
InterfaceType.longDescription: This property shall contain the interface type of the installed Trusted Module.

TrustedModules.description: This object describes the inventory of a Trusted Modules installed in the system.

enumDescriptions.Others: Indicates the others system boot up device except Cd,Hdd,Pxe.
enumDescriptions.Cd: a digitally encoded recording on an optical disk that is smaller than a phonograph record; played back by a laser.

enumDescriptions.InPost: The server is booting and has not reached discovery complete.
enumDescriptions.InPostDiscoveryComplete: The server has reached discovery complete. Discovery complete is the point at which the PCIe device scan is complete.
enumDescriptions.FinishedPost: The server has booted the installed OS.

PostState.description: The current state of system POST.
PostState.longDescription: The current state of system POST.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

SystemType.description: The type of computer system represented by this resource.
SystemType.longDescription: An enumeration that indicates the kind of system that this resource represents.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.longDescription: This object represents the Oem property.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

Chassis.description: An array of references to the chassis in which this system is contained.
Chassis.longDescription: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type Chassis that represents the physical container associated with this resource.

ManagedBy.description: An array of references to the Managers responsible for this system.
ManagedBy.longDescription: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type manager that represents the resource with management responsibility for this resource.

PoweredBy.description: An array of ID[s] of resources that power this computer system. Normally the ID will be a chassis or a specific set of Power Supplies.
PoweredBy.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an array of IDs containing pointers consistent with JSON pointer syntax to the resource that powers this computer system.

CooledBy.description: An array of ID[s] of resources that cool this computer system. Normally the ID will be a chassis or a specific set of fans.
CooledBy.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an array of IDs containing pointers consistent with JSON pointer syntax to the resource that powers this computer system.

Endpoints.description: An array of references to the endpoints that connect to this system.
Endpoints.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a reference to the resources that this system is associated with and shall reference a resource of type Endpoint.

Links.description: Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
Links.longDescription: The Links property, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.

AssetTag.description: The user definable tag that can be used to track this computer system for inventory or other client purposes.
AssetTag.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the value of the asset tag of the system.

Manufacturer.description: The manufacturer or OEM of this system.
Manufacturer.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain a value that represents the manufacturer of the system.

Model.description: The model number for this system.
Model.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the information about how the manufacturer references this system.

SKU.description: The manufacturer SKU for this system.
SKU.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) for the system.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number for this product.
SerialNumber.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the serial number for the product.

PartNumber.description: The part number for this system.
PartNumber.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the part number for the system as defined by the manufacturer.

UUID.description: The universal unique identifier (UUID) for this system.
UUID.longDescription: The value of this property shall be used to contain a universal unique identifier number for the system. RFC4122 describes methods that can be used to create the value. The value should be considered to be opaque. Client software should only treat the overall value as a universally unique identifier and should not interpret any sub-fields within the UUID. If the system supports SMBIOS, the value of the property should be formed by following the SMBIOS 2.6+ recommendation for converting the SMBIOS 16-byte UUID structure into the redfish canonical xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx string format so that the property value matches the byte order presented by current OS APIs such as WMI and dmidecode. Huawei changes the value of readonly from true to false.

HostName.description: The DNS Host Name, without any domain information.
HostName.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the host name for this system, as reported by the operating system or hypervisor.  This value is typically provided to the Manager by a service running in the host operating system.

IndicatorLED.description: The state of the indicator LED, used to identify the system.
IndicatorLED.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the indicator light state for the indicator light associated with this system.

PowerState.description: This is the current power state of the system.
PowerState.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the power state of the system.

Boot.description: Information about the boot settings for this system.
Boot.longDescription: This object shall contain properties which describe boot information for the current resource. Changes to this object do not alter the BIOS persistent boot order configuration.

BiosVersion.description: The version of the system BIOS or primary system firmware.
BiosVersion.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the version string of the currently installed and running BIOS (for x86 systems).  For other systems, the value may contain a version string representing the primary system firmware.

ProcessorSummary.description: This object describes the central processors of the system in general detail.
ProcessorSummary.longDescription: This object shall contain properties which describe the central processors for the current resource.

MemorySummary.description: This object describes the central memory of the system in general detail.
MemorySummary.longDescription: This object shall contain properties which describe the central memory for the current resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.
This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.

Processors.description: A reference to the collection of Processors associated with this system.
Processors.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type ProcessorCollection.

EthernetInterfaces.description: A reference to the collection of Ethernet interfaces associated with this system.
EthernetInterfaces.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type EthernetInterfaceCollection.

SimpleStorage.description: A reference to the collection of storage devices associated with this system.
SimpleStorage.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type SimpleStorageCollection.

LogServices.description: A reference to the collection of Log Services associated with this system.
LogServices.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type LogServiceCollection.

TrustedModules.description: This object describes the array of Trusted Modules in the system.
TrustedModules.longDescription: This object shall contain an array of objects with properties which describe the truted modules for the current resource.

SecureBoot.description: A reference to the UEFI SecureBoot resource associated with this system.
SecureBoot.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a resource of type SecureBoot.

Bios.description: A reference to the BIOS settings associated with this system.
Bios.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a resource of type Bios that lists the BIOS settings for this system.

Memory.description: A reference to the collection of Memory associated with this system.
Memory.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type MemoryCollection.

Storage.description: A reference to the collection of storage devices associated with this system.
Storage.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type StorageCollection.

HostingRoles.description: The hosing roles that this computer system supports.
HostingRoles.longDescription: The values of this collection shall be the hosting roles supported by this computer system.

HostedServices.description: The services that this computer system supports.
HostedServices.longDescription: The values of this collection shall describe services supported by this computer system.

PCIeDevices.description: A reference to a collection of PCIe Devices used by this computer system.
PCIeDevices.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an array of references of type PCIeDevice.

PCIeFunctions.description: A reference to a collection of PCIe Functions used by this computer system.
PCIeFunctions.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an array of references of type PCIeFunction.

MemoryDomains.description: A reference to the collection of Memory Domains associated with this system.
MemoryDomains.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type MemoryDomainCollection.

ComputerSystem.description: This schema defines a computer system and its respective properties.  A computer system represents a machine (physical or virtual) and the local resources such as memory, cpu and other devices that can be accessed from that machine.
ComputerSystem.longDescription: This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a computing system in the Redfish specification.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

CriticalAlarmCount.description: Number of critical alarms generated in the system.
CriticalAlarmCount.longDescription: This property indicates the total number of critical alarms generated in the system.

MajorAlarmCount.description: Number of major alarms generated in the system.
MajorAlarmCount.longDescription: This property indicates the total number of major alarms generated in the system.

MinorAlarmCount.description: Number of minor alarms generated in the system.
MinorAlarmCount.longDescription: This property indicates the total number of minor alarms generated in the system.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

StorageServices.description: A reference to a collection of storage services supported by this computer system
StorageServices.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type HostedStorageServices.

HostedServices.description: This object describes services that may be running or installed on the system.

enumDescriptions.ApplicationServer: The system hosts functionality that supports general purpose applications.
enumDescriptions.StorageServer: The system hosts functionality that supports the system acting as a storage server.
enumDescriptions.Switch: The system hosts functionality that supports the system acting as a switch.

HostingRole.description: The enumerations of HostingRoles specify different features that the hosting ComputerSystem supports.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

ProtocolType.description: Protocol type of the trusted module.
ProtocolType.longDescription: Indicates the protocol type of the trusted module.

ProtocolVersion.description: Protocol version of the trusted module.
ProtocolVersion.longDescription: Indicates the protocol version of the trusted module.

Manufacturer.longDescription: Indicates the manufacturer of the trusted module.

SelfTestResult.description: Self test result of the trusted module.
SelfTestResult.longDescription: Indicates the self test result of the trusted module, which can be OK or Critical.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

HealthSummary.description: Overview of the system health status.
HealthSummary.longDescription: This property provides an overview of the system health status, including the number of critical, major, and minor alarms generated in the system.

MajorPatchVersion.description: Indicates the major OS patch version.
MajorPatchVersion.longDescription: Indicates the major OS patch version.

MinorPatchVersion.description: Indicates the minor OS patch version.
MinorPatchVersion.longDescription: Indicates the minor OS patch version.

HostnameSyncEnabled.description: Specifies whether to synchronize the hostname to the BMC when the iBMA is running.
HostnameSyncEnabled.longDescription: Specifies whether to synchronize the hostname to the BMC when the iBMA is installed and running properly.

DomainName.description: Indicates the domain name of the computer.
DomainName.longDescription: Indicates the domain name of the computer.

HostDescription.description: Provides supplementary information about the host.
HostDescription.longDescription: Provides supplementary information about the host.

iBMAService.description: Indicates the iBMA service of the computer.
iBMAService.longDescription: Indicates the iBMA service of the computer.

iBMARunningStatus.description: Indicates the iBMA running status of the computer.
iBMARunningStatus.longDescription: Indicates the iBMA running status of the computer.

iBMADriver.description: Indicates the iBMA driver of the computer.
iBMADriver.longDescription: Indicates the iBMA driver of the computer.

NetBandwidthThresholdPercent.description: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the network bandwidth usage.
NetBandwidthThresholdPercent.longDescription: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the network bandwidth usage.

DeviceSlotID.description: Identifies the slot in which the device is installed.
DeviceSlotID.longDescription: Identifies the slot in which the device is installed.

StorageConfigReady.description: Indicates that the RAID controller card configuration can be exported.
StorageConfigReady.longDescription: Indicates that the RAID controller card configuration can be exported.

CPUThresholdPercent.description: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the CUP usage.
CPUThresholdPercent.longDescription: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the CUP usage.

MemoryThresholdPercent.description: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the memory usage.
MemoryThresholdPercent.longDescription: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the memory usage.

HardDiskThresholdPercent.description: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the disk usage.
HardDiskThresholdPercent.longDescription: Indicates the maximum threshold (%) of the disk usage.

WakeOnLANStatus.description: Wake On LAN (WOL) allows WOL-compliant commands to be sent to a server over the network to restore the server to normal operation from hibernation or shutdown state.
WakeOnLANStatus.longDescription: Wake On LAN (WOL) allows WOL-compliant commands to be sent to a server over the network to restore the server to normal operation from hibernation or shutdown state.

CPUPowerAdjustment.longDescription: You can adjust the system power consumption by setting the CPU operating frequency and CPU duty cycle.

CPUTotalCores.description: Indicates the total number of CPU cores.
CPUTotalCores.longDescription: Indicates the total number of CPU cores.

SystemMemoryBuffersGiB.description: Size (in GB) of the system memory buffer.
SystemMemoryBuffersGiB.longDescription: Size (in GB) of the system memory buffer.

SystemMemoryCachedGiB.description: Size (in GB) of the system memory cache.
SystemMemoryCachedGiB.longDescription: Size (in GB) of the system memory cache.

SystemSerialNumber.description: The serial number for this system.
SystemSerialNumber.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the serial number for the system.

SafePowerOffTimeoutEnabled.description: Indicates the timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation could be used or not.
SafePowerOffTimeoutEnabled.longDescription: Indicates the timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation could be used or not.

SafePowerOffTimoutSeconds.description: Indicates the timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.
SafePowerOffTimoutSeconds.longDescription: Indicates the timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.

SafePowerOffDefaultTimeoutSeconds.description: Indicates the default timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.
SafePowerOffDefaultTimeoutSeconds.longDescription: Indicates the default timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.

SafePowerOffMaxTimeoutSeconds.description: Indicates the maximum timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.
SafePowerOffMaxTimeoutSeconds.longDescription: Indicates the maximum timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.

SafePowerOffMinTimeoutSeconds.description: Indicates the minimum timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.
SafePowerOffMinTimeoutSeconds.longDescription: Indicates the minimum timeout period (in seconds) of the safe power-off operation.

PanelPowerButtonEnabled.description: Indicates the power button on the server panel could be used or not.
PanelPowerButtonEnabled.longDescription: Indicates the power button on the server panel could be used or not.

PowerOnStrategy.description: Specifies the power-on strategy of the server.
PowerOnStrategy.longDescription: Specifies the power-on strategy of the server.

PowerOnStrategyExceptions.description: The exceptions of power on strategy.
PowerOnStrategyExceptions.longDescription: The exceptions of power on strategy.

LeakDetectionSupport.description: Indicates the server support leakage detection or not.
LeakDetectionSupport.longDescription: Indicates the server support leakage detection or not.

LeakStrategy.description: Specifies the power-off strategy after leakage.
LeakStrategy.longDescription: Specifies the power-off strategy after leakage.

PowerRestoreDelayMode.description: Specifies the power restore delay mode of the server.
PowerRestoreDelayMode.longDescription: Specifies the power restore delay mode of the server.

PowerRestoreDelaySeconds.description: Specifies the power restore delay seconds of the server.
PowerRestoreDelaySeconds.longDescription: Specifies the power restore delay seconds of the server.

LocalKvmEnabled.description: Indicates the enabled states of local KVM.
LocalKvmEnabled.longDescription: Indicates the enabled states of local KVM.

PowerOnAfterCpuThermalTrip.description: The power on policy after cpu thermal trip
PowerOnAfterCpuThermalTrip.longDescription: Specifies the activation status of the power on policy after cpu thermal trip.

DelaySecondsAfterCpuThermalTrip.description: The delay seconds for executing power on policy
DelaySecondsAfterCpuThermalTrip.longDescription: Specifies the delay seconds for executing power on policy after cpu thermal trip.

BootupSequence.description: Specifies the system boot sequence, that is, the boot sequence of CD, HDD, PXE, and other devices.
BootupSequence.longDescription: Specifies the system boot sequence, that is, the boot sequence of CD, HDD, PXE, and other devices.

CmccVersion.description: Indicates the version information of CMCC.
CmccVersion.longDescription: Indicates the version information of CMCC.

Version.description: Indicates the version information of CUCC.
Version.longDescription: Indicates the version information of CUCC.

ProductAlias.description: Indicates the alias of the product.
ProductAlias.longDescription: Indicates the alias of the product.

ProductName.description: Indicates the name of the product.
ProductName.longDescription: Indicates the name of the product.

PchModel.description: Indicates the Model of the product South Bridge chip.
PchModel.longDescription: Indicates the Model of the product South Bridge chip.

ProductVersion.description: Indicates the version of the product.
ProductVersion.longDescription: Indicates the version of the product.

enumDescriptions.Lit: The System health LED is lit.
enumDescriptions.Blinking: The System health LED is blinking.
enumDescriptions.Off: The System health LED is off.

SwitchIpInfo.description: Indicates the IP address of the switch plane of the E9000 server.
SwitchIpInfo.longDescription: Indicates the IP address of the switch plane of the E9000 server.

SwitchInfo.description: Indicates all information of the switch plane of the E9000 server.
SwitchInfo.longDescription: Indicates all information of the switch plane of the E9000 server.

StorageSummary.description: This object describes the storage of the system in general detail.
StorageSummary.longDescription: This object shall contain properties which describe the storage for the current resource.

LogicalDriveSummary.description: This object describes the logical drives of the system in general detail.
LogicalDriveSummary.longDescription: This object shall contain properties which describe the logical drives for the current resource.

StorageSubsystemSummary.description: This object describes the storage subsystem of the system in general detail.
StorageSubsystemSummary.longDescription: This object shall contain properties which describe the storage subsystem for the current resource.

StorageViewsSummary.description: This object specifies a summary of storage views.
StorageViewsSummary.longDescription: This object specifies a summary of storage views.

BootModeIpmiSWDisplayEnabled.description: Specifies whether Set Boot Mode over IPMI is displayed on the web page.
BootModeIpmiSWDisplayEnabled.longDescription: Specifies whether Set Boot Mode over IPMI is displayed on the web page.

BootModeConfigOverIpmiEnabled.description: Indicates whether the BIOS boot mode can be changed over IPMI. If the boot mode cannot be changed, this property is read-only.
BootModeConfigOverIpmiEnabled.longDescription: Indicates whether the BIOS boot mode can be changed over IPMI. If the boot mode cannot be changed, this property is read-only.

EnergySavingEnabled.description: Setting of the intelligent energy saving function, which can be enabled or disabled. If it is enabled, the BIOS dynamic energy saving parameter configuration is supported.
EnergySavingEnabled.longDescription: Setting of the intelligent energy saving function, which can be enabled or disabled. If it is enabled, the BIOS dynamic energy saving parameter configuration is supported.

ProcessorsHistoryUsageRate.description: Percentage of CPU resources used by applications in running.
ProcessorsHistoryUsageRate.longDescription: Percentage of CPU resources used by applications in running.

MemoryHistoryUsageRate.description: Percentage of memory resources used by applications in running.
MemoryHistoryUsageRate.longDescription: Percentage of memory resources used by applications in running.

NetworkHistoryUsageRate.description: Percentage of the bandwidth used by of all the LOM and PCIe network ports to the total bandwidth.
NetworkHistoryUsageRate.longDescription: Percentage of the bandwidth used by of all the LOM and PCIe network ports to the total bandwidth.

BiosDynamicParamConfig.description: Configuration of the BIOS dynamic energy saving parameters.
BiosDynamicParamConfig.longDescription: Configuration of the BIOS dynamic energy saving parameters.

NpuAbility.description: AI chip computing capability configuration information on the Atlas server.
NpuAbility.longDescription: AI chip computing capability configuration information on the Atlas server.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.
This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

PartitionName.description: Indicates the name of a partition.
PartitionName.longDescription: Indicates the name of a partition.

UsedCapacityGB.description: Indicates the used capacity (in GB) of the partition.
UsedCapacityGB.longDescription: Indicates the used capacity (in GB) of the partition.

TotalCapacityGB.description: Indicates the total capacity (in GB) of the partition.
TotalCapacityGB.longDescription: Indicates the total capacity (in GB) of the partition.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

CPUPLimit.longDescription: Adjusts the maximum CPU operating frequency (%).

CPUTLimit.longDescription: Adjusts the maximum CPU duty cycle (%).

enumDescriptions.TurnOn: The OS starts automatically after the power is supplied.
enumDescriptions.RestorePreviousState: The server restores its status before the power-off after the power is supplied: If the OS starts before the server is powered off, the OS starts automatically after the power is supplied.If the OS is shut down before the server is powered off, the OS remains shut-down after the power is supplied.
enumDescriptions.StayOff: The OS remains shut-down after the power is supplied.

enumDescriptions.FirmwareActive: AC cycle caused by active power-off of BMC

enumDescriptions.ManualPowerOff: When leakage occurred on the liquid cooling device,iBMC report an alarm but don't power-off OS.
enumDescriptions.AutoPowerOff: When leakage occurred on the liquid cooling device,iBMC report an alarm and power-off OS automatically.

enumDescriptions.DefaultDelay: For Rack-type server, random delay between 0 and 2 seconds; for blade-type server, according to the slot, each slot delay is 500ms.
enumDescriptions.RandomDelay: Random delay from 0 to specified time.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Address.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an IPv6 address assigned to this interface.

PrefixLength.description: This is the IPv6 prefix length.
PrefixLength.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the IPv6 prefix length for this address.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Address.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an IPv6 address assigned to this interface.

PrefixLength.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the IPv6 prefix length for this address.

Gateway.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an IPv6 gateway assigned to this interface.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Address.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an IPv4 address assigned to this interface.  If DHCPv4 is enabled on the interface, this property becomes read-only.

SubnetMask.description: This is the IPv4 Subnet mask.
SubnetMask.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the IPv4 subnet mask for this address.  If DHCPv4 is enabled on the interface, this property becomes read-only.

Gateway.description: This is the IPv4 gateway for this address.
Gateway.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the IPv4 default gateway address for this interface. If DHCPv4 is enabled on the interface and is configured to set the IPv4 default gateway address, this property becomes read-only.

IPv6Addresses.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an IPv6 address assigned to this interface.

IPv6Routes.longDescription: The value of this property shall be an IPv6 routes assigned to this interface.

Version.longDescription: The value of this property contains versions of different components.

StackingStatus.description: This is the Plane Stacking status.
StackingStatus.longDescription: There are 4 states of stacking: none, master, standby, slave.

FruType.longDescription: The value of this property shall contain the type of the FRU.
